author: Lou Natick
comment: Last update seems to have done something to this app, now entering a place to All Shops does not show up in Shopping List. Help is too confusing. Have been using this app for years and never had problems till now. Tried for an hour just to enter a shop to no avail, used to be real easy. Cleared cache, also to no avail. App has other issues with Categories and other sections,too. App is now useless to me. LG G2, Android 5.0.2 vers.

author: Paul O
comment: Ugh, this is the third Wearable shopping list app I've tried and all three have big problems. Bring! won't come up in any language other than SwissGerman, Listonic only allows Wearable input of dictation (no keyboard input), and this won't even let you make or add to a list on your wearable! *grumble...

Did I read correctly, on the IAP section of the app page, that this apps Pro version costs $329.99?  Update: After using this app for about 10 minutes, I finally realized that it's not for me.  I'll stick with OneNote.

reply.author: Lister Studios
reply.content: Hi, there is no in-app items available anymore. They are not accessible to buy from within Lister. All features are available for free. The in-app items need to be there for former users. Thank you for your understanding!

comment: I wish you could choose where the ad's show up - top OR BOTTOM of screen, so you don't click on the wrong list when the ad pops in.   Also it would be great if you could add one more level of sub-categories to lists.   Thank you for considering to my feedback!

reply.author: Lister Studios
reply.content: Hi, thank you for the feedback. Could you explain your use case for the subcategories please? You can reach out directly via email at ask@lister-studios.com. Greetings!

author: Lloyd Elsenheimer
comment: A little complex to set up but excellent after that. Find a friendlier way to set up and you easily would deserve 5 stars

author: Fizes
comment: Great app but when i activated categories i can't manually sort items, only categories. Why is that?

reply.author: Lister Studios
reply.content: Hi, items are sorted by alphabet within a category. If there is too many items in a category I suggest to create more specific categories, i.e. 'fruit & veg' becomes two categories 'fruit' and 'veg'. I hope this helps. You can always send an email to ask@lister-studios.com. Greetings!

author: Don Reid
comment: Great app.  I use it for all my shopping lists.

author: rafeeq ahmed
comment: Fulfills my need  :: it's 5 star from me...

author: Marie Krugolets
comment: Nice app, easy to use. Fast support as well. I tried a good number of similar apps and this one is the best I've seen. I also like that switching to pro version without ads is simply a matter of getting a code from developers.  One thing i would suggest is that this pro version code can be linked to user email so that it can be used on multiple devices instead of requiring a new code for each device. Also it is not very clear at first how to update to pro version, so i would suggest including a bettet explanation in the help section.

author: Tom Beezley
comment: I may give it 5 stars after I've used it for awhile. Liking it so far.

author: Diana Leslie
comment: Super easy to use. I like the feature that saves all your previous list items, I use it to check my past items to "browse" for things I've forgotten to add to my shopping list. Plus I've assigned a category to these items so my list is organized for the most efficient trip to the store. All produce items grouped together, dairy, etc no matter in what order I added them to my shopping list. I just keep a running list as I see what's needed at home, and open it once I'm at the store. Can't live without it.

I loved this app until the last update. Now no matter how many times I plug in my Pro User order number (paid to disable ads), I still see bloody ads popping up and I can't turn them off. I'm waiting for a fix and looking for a new app at the same time.    Update: Issue was resolved very quickly. Excellent customer service.

reply.author: Lister Studios
reply.content: Hi, please get in touch with support at ask@lister-studios.com. You will receive immediate support to fix the ad issue. Greetings

author: Michael Morse
comment: One important feature that improves this app over others is the ability to choose "long press" to mark items purchased. With another app I used I was unintentionally marking items as purchased while handling the phone. The customization is great also.

author: Leon Robbins
comment: The old Pro licence no longer removes ads – it just stops them from blinking. It's time to find a shopping list app made by a more honest developer.

reply.author: Lister Studios
reply.content: Hi, former Pro users are ad free and will be ad free. If this is not the case with you please get in touch via email at ask@lister-studios.com. Greetings

author: Anne Merrill
comment: Excellent for posting groceries and other needs on tablet and then having it on phone for shopping. Makes seperate lists for different stores. Great for repetitive do lists, such as travel or packing items, or even special occasion lists. Great customer service when needed.

reply.author: Lister Studios
reply.content: Hi, please get in touch with support at ask@lister-studios.com and a solution will be found quickly. Greetings!

author: Ben Griffiths
comment: Great support response. My one issue (no support for whitespace in passwords) was fixed very quickly. Sync is seamless so far and UI feels good.

reply.author: Lister Studios
reply.content: Hi, sorry to hear that. Please send an email to ask@lister-studios.com and you'll receive support straight away. Greetings

author: Heather Farar
comment: I use this app all the time and love it! It holds all my shopping lists for each store and a variety of to do lists (daily, projects, baby names, bucket, notes, you name it). I love how easy it is to add, check off, rearrange priority, delete, or categorize an item on the list. Love how it remembers my previous entries too. Very easy to use and to personalize. Can't live without it anymore!

author: John Byerly
comment: I've been using this app two or three times a week for several months and it works great. Syncs nicely with Android Wear. Would like for it to retain manual sort order from one shopping trip to the next. Other than that, it's a great shopping tool.

reply.author: Lister Studios
reply.content: Thank you for the nice review. I highly recommend to use the category feature. Then your items will stay in order. You can reach support anytime at ask@lister-studios.com. Greetings

author: Kathleen Culley
comment: I like that I can do several lists so i can have 1 for each store or christmas gifts, etc. I use it all the time. Easy to check off what i put in my basket and still keeps items in memory for another time

author: Hugh Gunz
comment: Extremely useful app. Once you've built up a list of items, which is very easy to do, it's very quick and easy to put shopping lists together. And the many ways of cataloguing items makes it a very powerful app.
I use this all the time for my shopping lists. It is easy to use and has what I need. Not too basic but not complicated either. Just perfect for me!!

author: Janet Dick
comment: Love this app, use it regularly for shopping and also for 'To Do' lists. Great that it keeps items previously entered and starts to display them as soon as you input them again.

author: Bogdan Gradinariu
comment: Very useful  app.  I like that i can export and import the list via email

author: Ron Fowler
comment: A great list app! Also great service when I had a problem.

author: Al McPhee
comment: Love that this is one of the few grocery apps that works with my Android Wear watch. Simple to check off my list on the watch, auto removal from my phone.

author: Mary Lou Nirdlinger
comment: Love the app. Only improvement I'd make is from the main Lists screen, I'd like to be able to sort individual items on each list.

author: Janis Marks-Kirkman
comment: Love this app, works great on my wearable too, which makes it a breeze when shopping.
Keeps everything organized, and helps me remember what I need.

author: JOSEPH SLEIGHTHOLME
comment: The best of 6 or 7 of the most popular I tried and tested

author: Heth Kirk
comment: I find this app really useful as I can manually sort items in order of the store layout for different shops.
I LOVE this app. Very easy to use. I keep 3 lists.
Use this for everything; shopping lists, packing list, to do lists, etc

author: Larry Magasano
comment: List works great. After 4 years still very happy.  Would encourage anyone to try this.

author: Jerry McFadyen
comment: I love the app and use it all the time
I practically use it all the time.especially the to do lists.it's easy to use and very handy

author: Paul Alexandru
comment: Great app, simple and easy to use, lots of features; love it!
Love this app. It keeps all kinds of lists at my fingertips.

author: Jason Frost
comment: Extremely useful if you spend a lot of time in the kitchen

author: A Google User
comment: Great app,  easy to use, and very helpful support.

author: Peter Corbett
comment: Purchased pro version. Best app on market
